revision.comment: Reverted to revision 863692829 by [[Special:Contributions/Polly Tunnel|Polly Tunnel]] ([[User talk:Polly Tunnel|talk]]): Rm poor image. There are better ones lower down in the article. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{About|the type of clothing|the footwear|flip-flops|other uses|Thong (disambiguation)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} [[File:Pinagbuyutan Private Beach.jpg|thumb|upright|Woman wearing a [[G-string]] style thong]] The '''thong''' is a [[Clothing|garment]] generally worn as either [[underwear]] or as a [[swimsuit]] in some countries. It may also be worn for traditional [[Ceremony|ceremonies]] or [[Sport|competitions]]. Viewed from the front, the thong typically resembles a [[bikini]] bottom, but at the back the material is reduced to a minimum. Thongs are almost always designed to cover the [[genitals]], [[anus]], and [[perineum]], and leave part or most of the [[buttocks]] uncovered. The back of the garment typically consists of a thin waistband and a thin strip of material, designed to be worn between the buttocks, that connects the middle of the waistband with the bottom front of the garment.{{cite web|url=http://m-w.com/dictionary/thong |title=Thong| publisher=Merriam-Webster |work=Online Dictionary|accessdate=3 April 2008}} It is also used as a descriptive term in other types of garment, such as a [[bodysuit]], [[bodystocking]], [[leotard]], or one-piece swimsuit in the context "thong backed". One type of thong is the [[G-string]], the back of which consists only of a (typically elasticized) string.Hydinger, Liss "[http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=LA&p_theme=la&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EF6153ABB456E98&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM Listen up, guys, here's a lingerie lingo lesson]", ''Daily News of Los Angeles'', 6 February 1992 The two terms ''G-string'' and ''thong'' are often used interchangeably; however, they can refer to distinct pieces of clothing. Thongs come in a variety of styles depending on the thickness, material, or type of the rear portion of fabric and are available for both men and women throughout most of the world. == Nomenclature == The origin of the word ''thong'' in the English language is from [[Old English]] ''thwong'', a flexible leather cord.{{cite web|url=http://m-w.com/dictionary/thong |title=Merriam-Webster online dictionary |publisher=M-w.com |accessdate=7 January 2012}} Many languages borrow the English word ''string'' to refer to this type of underwear, usually without the ''G''. Another common name is ''[[Tanga (clothing)|tanga]]'' (or sometimes ''string tanga''), especially in the German ''Tanga''. A frequent metaphor, especially in Brazil, is dental floss; in Brazil a thong is called ''fio dental'' (Portuguese for dental floss); in English, the term "Butt floss" is sometimes used. In [[Lithuanian language|Lithuanian]] it is "siaurikės" ("narrows"), Italian "perizoma" or "tanga", in [[Turkish language|Turkish]] "ipli külot" ("stringed underpants"), and in [[Bulgarian language|Bulgarian]] as "prashka" ({{lang|bg|прашка}}), which means a slingshot. In [[Israel]] the thong, mostly the G-string, is called ''Khutini'' ({{lang|he|חוטיני}}), from the word Khut, which means String. Similarly, in [[Iran]], it is called "Shortbandi" ({{lang|fa|شورت بندی}}) in which "short" (from English: Shorts) means "briefs" and "bandi" means "with a string". A [[Puerto Rican Spanish]] slang term, used by [[Reggaeton]] artists, is ''gistro''. Australians often colloquially refer to the ''G-string'' as a ''g-banger'' or simply ''banger''. Some names for the thong reference the bareness of the buttocks, as seen in the Spanish word ''colaless'' (the origin is probably connected to the term topless but in reference to ''cola'', colloquial term for butt in South American Spanish), and in other names the "T"-like shape of the back is highlighted. In [[Chinese language|Chinese]], the T-back is commonly called ''dingziku'' (丁字褲/丁字裤) which literally means ''丁 character pants'' (or roughly, ''T-letter pants''). In Korean, it is called 티팬티 (''T panty''). However, there are several usages of the term T-back in English as well (e.g., children's literature author [[E. L. Konigsburg]]'s ''T-backs, T-shirts, Coat and Suit''). === Thong vs. G-string === According to the ''Encyclopedia of Clothing and Fashion'', "The G-string, or thong, [is] a panty front with a half- to one-inch strip of fabric at the back that sits between the buttocks",Steele, Valerie (2005) ''Encyclopedia of Clothing and Fashion''. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons {{ISBN|0-684-31396-0}}; p. 121 and ''Knickers: a Brief History'' says: "Minor tweaks to the cut earned these skimpy panties different titles—from the thong, which has a one-inch strip of fabric down the back, to a G-string, which, as the name equivalent of Spanish suggests (hilo dental), is more like a string of fabric akin between the teeth."Tomczak, Sarah & Pask, Rachel (2004) ''Knickers: a Brief History''. London: Allen & Unwin {{ISBN|1-74114-480-9}} ''Striptease: the Untold History of the Girlie Show'' says: "The thong [is] an [[undergarment]] derived from the stripper's G-string",{{cite book|last=Steir|first=Rachel|year=2004|title=Striptease: The Untold History of the Girlie Show|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vPwVfOUWAe0C|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=9780195127508|page=417}} and according to ''Americanisms: the Illustrated Book of Words Made in the USA'' a G-string is "a thong panty consisting of a small triangular piece of fabric supported by two elastic straps. Attributed to strippers circa 1936".Luke, Gary & Quin, Susan R. (2003) ''Americanisms: the Illustrated Book of Words Made in the USA''. Sasquatch Books {{ISBN|1-57061-385-0}} The ''Heinemann English Dictionary'' defines "thong" as "a pair of underpants or swimming costume in a very skimpy style like a G-string".Heinemann Staff, Manser, Martin & Feinstein, Jessica (2001) ''Heinemann English Dictionary''. London: Heinemann {{ISBN|0-435-10424-1}}; p. 1072 == History == The thong, like its probable predecessor the [[loincloth]], is believed to be one of the earliest forms of human clothing and is also thought to have been worn mostly or exclusively by men. It is thought the thong was probably originally developed to protect, support, or hide the male genitals. The loincloth is probably the earliest form of clothing used by mankind, having originated in the warmer climates of [[sub-Saharan Africa]] where clothing was first worn nearly 75,000 years ago. Many tribal peoples, such as some of the [[Khoisan]] people of southern Africa, wore thongs for many centuries. Much like the Japanese [[fundoshi]], these early garments were made with the male genitalia in mind. According to some fashion historians, the first public appearance of the thong in the United States was at the [[1939 New York World's Fair]]. This resulted from [[Fiorello LaGuardia]], the [[Mayor of New York City]], ordering the city's nude dancers to cover themselves.{{cite book|title=Lessons in Lingerie: Finding Your Perfect Shade of Seduction|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=tS9T3Xf5B_gC|first=Rebecca |last=Apsan|publisher=Workman Publishing|year=2012|isbn=9780761175018|page=87}} Jacques Heim's and Louis Réard's original [[bikini]] from 1946 (that introduced the term ''bikini'') had a [[culotte]] with a thong back. == Modern thong == Fashion designer [[Rudi Gernreich]], who in the mid-1960s created the first [[topless swimsuit]], which he called the [[monokini]], is credited with introducing the modern thong in 1974{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2001/sep/28/news/cl-50719|title=Fashion designer Rudi Gernreich defied haute-couture rules with socially aware clothes that said ...|work=latimes | first=Booth|last=Moore|date=28 September 2001}}{{cite news|url=http://content.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,2110513_2110512_2110662,00.html|title=Rudi Gernreich – All-TIME Top 100 Icons in Fashion, Style and Design – TIME|date=2 April 2012|work=TIME.com|first=Lily|last=Rothman}}{{cite newspaper |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=zGQEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA74&dq=Rudi+Gernreich+thong#v=onepage&q=Rudi%20Gernreich%20thong&f=false|title=Reviving Rudi |work=The Advocate}}{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=4666-dlamoEC|page=54|title=A Century of Austrian Design: 1900-2005|first1=Tulga|last1=Beyerle|first2=Karin|last2=Hirschberger|publisher=Walter de Gruyter|year=2006|isbn=9783034608893}} when he designed a thong bikini in response to a ban on nude sunbathing by the [[Los Angeles City Council]].{{cite newspaper|title=Thongs for the memories: As sales of M&S G-strings drop we chart rise & fall of the iconic undies |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/news/1098902/thongs-for-the-memories-as-sales-of-ms-g-strings-drop-we-chart-rise-fall-of-the-iconic-undies/ |newspaper=The Sun |location=United Kingdom |author=Gabriele Dirvanauskas |date=24 March 2016}} [[File:Thong (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Woman wearing a T-back thong in [[Sunrise, Florida]], US in 2006]] Attitudes toward the wearing of g-strings vary geographically and across societies, as is usual with highly revealing clothing. Prior to its entrance into mainstream fashion, g-strings were primarily worn by exotic dancers. In the modern Western world, g-strings are more commonly marketed towards females but are worn by both sexes. During the 1980s, thongs were worn on stage by pop stars such as [[Cher]] and [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]].{{cite newspaper |title=Good riddance to the thong! After decades of discomfort, women have finally cracked |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/life/good-riddance-to-the-thong-after-decades-of-discomfort-women-hav/ |date=18 September 2017 |author=Claire Cohen|newspaper=The Telegraph |location=United Kingdom}} By the late-1980s, the style (for females) had made its way into most of the Western world; thong underwear became more popular through the 1990s due to TV shows such as: ''[[Baywatch]]'', where numerous females were recorded wearing thong swimsuits. In the 1990s, the thong began to gain wider acceptance and popularity in the United States as underwear (and, to a lesser extent, as swimwear), especially with women, but also men. In the USA and Europe, the wearing of thongs by men was once mainly limited to the [[dance belt]], the posing pouch for [[bodybuilders]] and the realm of male [[strippers]]. Men's thongs are now more widely available and commonly worn as day-to-day underwear or swimwear. While some major retailers such as [[Kmart]] sell men's thongs,{{cite web |url=http://www.kmart.com/joe-boxer-men-s-thong-underwear-4-pack/p-99900600zo287000P?prdNo=9&blockNo=9&blockType=G9|title=Kmart.com|work=kmart.com}} they are not marketed as strongly to men as they are to women. In Europe, thongs have been commonplace for many more years both as underwear and swimwear. In the 2000s, some people wore thongs with low-cut hipsters and deliberately exposed them over the top of their trousers, producing an effect popularly known as a [[whale tail]]. This led to many thong designs intended to be worn in this manner, which were adorned with jewels and motifs on the back. In the early-2000s, thongs made up 31% of the women's underwear market. However, in the late-2000s, the exposure of a thong above one's trousers became less popular and the trend turned to the wearing of lower-riding thongs that hardly show above trousers, except when bending or twisting. [[Market research]] in 2011 placed the number of French women who wear thongs as their preferred underwear style at 25%, down by 5% from 2008.{{cite web|title=Male and female views on underwear|url=http://www.womenology.com/reflexions/male-female-views-underwear/|website=Womenology|publisher=[[aufeminin]]|date=16 February 2012|accessdate=8 January 2016}}{{cite news|title=L'avenir du string compromis face aux shorties et aux tangas|url=http://www.terrafemina.com/vie-privee/sexo/articles/10229-lavenir-du-string-compromis-face-aux-shorties-et-aux-tangas.html|work=[[:fr:Terrafemina|Terrafemina]]|date=15 January 2012|language=French|accessdate=8 January 2016}} By 2016, sales of thongs in the UK were on the decline with [[Marks & Spencer]], a major UK lingerie retailer, reporting that they made up fewer than 10% of knickers sold. Many reasons exist as to why people may choose to wear thong underwear or swimwear, such as prevention of [[panty line|visible panty lines]],{{cite magazine|last=Wallis |first=Claudia |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1005821,00.html?internalid=ACA |title=The Thing About Thongs: Why the bottom line has become a battleground for parents of tweens |magazine=Time |date=6 October 2003 |accessdate=7 January 2012}} prevention of underwear "riding up" so one need not pull at one's underwear in public, comfort, fashion consciousness including the feeling of being more adult, and minimization of tan lines.{{cite magazine|title=Would You Dare to Wear a Thong Bikini to the Beach?|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/fashion-trends-thong-bikini-kendall-jenner-bella-hadid|magazine=Vogue|date=28 July 2017|author=Brooke Bobb|quote=...it is the perfect suit to avoid unnecessary tan lines.}} == Design and variety == {| class="wikitable right" style="float:right; background:#ffffe0;" |+ String thongs ! rowspan="2"| Backs !!colspan="4"| Sides |- !Strap !Tie-side !Strapless |- | style="text-align:left;"| '''Low'''
'''coverage''' | style="text-align:center;"|[[File:Underwear - V back, strap sides.png|60px|Underwear – V back]]
V-string, T-front | style="text-align:center;"|[[File:Underwear - string back, tie sides.png|60px|Underwear – string back]]
T-back | style="text-align:center;"|Maebari |- | style="text-align:left;"| '''Medium'''
'''coverage''' | style="text-align:center;"|[[File:Underwear - triangle back, strap sides.png|60px|Underwear – triangle back]]
G-string | | style="text-align:center;"|[[File:CStringIllustration.svg|60px|Underwear – C back]]
C-string |- | style="text-align:left;"| '''High'''
'''coverage''' | style="text-align:center;"|Cheeky | | |} Types of thongs include the traditional thong, the G-string, and the C-string. There are a number of intermediate kinds of thongs between full rear coverage and a string rear. As designs become more risqué there are also types intended to expose genitals as much as they conceal them. Other styles include the Cheeky, V-string, T-front and T-back. The naming of the intermediate styles of thong is debatable, different vendors use the words somewhat interchangeably. Thongs are available in a wide variety of materials, including silk, [[latex]], cotton, [[microfiber]], [[satin]], nylon, and [[spandex|lycra/spandex]]. There are also novelty designs for both sexes, featuring shapes to conform to the genitals or provide humorous visual effects. The most significant difference between thongs designed for men and women is the shape of the front part of the garment. Often, but not always, thongs for men will feature a vertical seam to create shape and space for the male genitalia, and the pouch may be made of stretchy material (usually cotton-Lycra or microfiber) for an ergonomic fit. The equivalent section in women's thongs is normally flat and seamless. However, the fabric is usually thicker in the area where it covers the [[vulva]] (by incorporating a cotton [[gusset]]). {{See also|Bikini|Bikini variants}} === {{anchor|G-string}} G-string === {{Main|G-string}} The G-string style consists of an elastic string (also a narrow piece of cloth, [[leather]], or [[plastic]]) that connects the front/pouch and the waistband at back, worn as [[swimsuit|swimwear]] or underwear mostly by women, but also by men. Since the mid-1920s, strippers and exotic dancers in the West have been referring to the style of thongs they wore for their performances as G-strings. ==== Etymology ==== The origin of the term ''G-string'' is obscure. It may simply stand for 'Gusset' as the G-String is in effect just a gusset on a string. Since the 19th century, the term ''geestring'' referred to the string which held the loincloth of [[Native Americans in the United States|American Indians]]Beadler, John Hanson (1877) "Western Wilds, and the Men who Redeem Them: an authentic narrative" [https://books.google.com/books?id=W-gTAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA249&dq=geestring p. 249], digitized text at [[Google Books]] and later referred to the narrow loincloth itself. [[William Safire]] in his ''Ode on a G-String'' quoted the usage of the word ''G-string'' for loincloth by ''[[Harper's Magazine]]'' 15 years after Beadle's and suggested that the magazine confused the word with the musical term ''G string'' (i.e., the [[string (music)|string]] for the G note). Safire also mentions the opinion of linguist Robert Hendrickson that "G" (or "gee") stands for [[groin]], which was a [[taboo word]] at the time.[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9D0CE5DF173CF937A3575BC0A967958260 "On Language; Ode on a G-String"], by William Safire, ''[[The New York Times]]'', 4 August 1991 ==== History ==== The g-string first appeared in costumes worn by showgirls in [[Earl Carroll]]'s productions during the [[Jazz Age]]. Linguist Robert Hendrickson believes that the 'g' stands for 'groin'.{{cite book|author=Rachel Shteir|title=Striptease: The Untold History of the Girlie Show|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vPwVfOUWAe0C&pg=PA202|accessdate=10 March 2013|date=1 November 2004|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19-512750-8|page=202}} The ''Oxford English Dictionary'' reports that the G-string was originally a narrow strip of fabric worn by Indian women. During the Depression, a "G-string" was known as "the gadget". During the 1930s, the "Chicago G-string" gained prominence when worn by performers like [[Margaret Hart Ferraro|Margie Hart]]. The Chicago area was the home of some of the largest manufacturers of G-strings and it also became the center of the [[burlesque]] shows in the United States. === Other variants of women's thongs === File:Thong 3.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#T-back|T-back]] File:C-string pink.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#C-string|C-string]] File:Delicious bikini-girl silvia (cropped).jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#Cheeky|Cheeky]] File:T-front string underwear.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#T-front|T-front]] ==== {{anchor|C-string}} C-string ==== As narrow as a G-string, but without the supporting "string" around the wearer's hips/panty line, leaving just a sideways ''C'' shaped piece between the legs. This is held in place firmly by a flexible internal frame. Since there is no material around the waist, the C-string completely eliminates the [[panties|panty lines]] which thongs and other underwear create. C-strings are also designed for use as [[beachwear]], which reduces the [[tan lines]] that would have been left by the side straps of even a G or V-String.{{cite news | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-458818/Forget-G-string--ANYONE-wear-new-C-string.html | work=[[Daily Mail]] |location=London | title=Forget the G-string – can ANYONE wear the new C-string? | author=Alice Smellie | date=31 May 2007 }} ==== Cheeky ==== A more conservative style called a cheeky covers a little more area, but exposes the bottom part of the buttocks. Some cheekies are used as undergarments while others function as bikini bottoms. ==== {{anchor|T-front}} T-front ==== A type of G-string in which the string reaches also the front part. It provides no coverage while still maintaining the basic hygienic underwear functions. Usually it is built by strings only, sometimes with more fabric or lace around the waist. Certain designs cover the string with pearls for decoration and stimulation reasons.{{cite magazine|url=http://completefashion.org/pearls-gone-wild-can-you-rock-the-single-strand-pearl-thong/|title=Pearls Gone Wild: Can You Rock The Single Strand Pearl Thong?|magazine=Complete Fashion|author=Cynthia Ejike|accessdate=21 September 2017}} === Men's thongs === File:India wrestling akhara training.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#Kowpeenam|Kowpeenam]] File:Japanese traditional swimwear FUNDOSHI red rokushaku back photomodel fthong 1.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#Fundoshi|Fundoshi]] File:Jockstrap-20070208.jpg|[[Thong (clothing)#Jockstrap|Jockstrap]] File:Dance belt.JPG|[[Thong (clothing)#Dance belt|Dance belt]] ==== Kowpeenam ==== {{Main|Kowpeenam}} Kaupinam is a thong worn in India, by some men as a [[loincloth]] or [[underclothing]]. It is made up of rectangular strip of cotton cloth which is used to cover the genitals with the help of the strings connected to the four ends of the cloth for binding it around the waist of the wearer. It is used by wrestlers in the game of Kushti or traditional Indian Wrestling in the Akhaada (Wrestling Ring) and also during practice sessions and training. ==== Fundoshi ==== {{Main|Fundoshi}} Fundoshi is the traditional [[Japan]]ese undergarment for adult males, made from a length of [[cotton]]. Before [[World War II]], the fundoshi was the main form of underwear for Japanese adult males. However, it fell out of use quickly after the war with the introduction of new underwear to the Japanese market, such as [[briefs]] and [[boxer briefs|trunks]]. Nowadays, the fundoshi is mainly used not as underwear but as festival (''[[matsuri]]'') clothing at [[Hadaka Matsuri]] or, sometimes, as swimwear. There are many other varieties of fundoshi as the variations on the principle of a loincloth are almost infinite. For example, the ''mokko-fundoshi'' (literally "earth-basket loincloth" because it looks like the traditional baskets used in construction) is made like the etchyuu-fundoshi but without a front apron; the cloth is secured to the belt to make a bikini effect. The ''kuro-neko fundoshi'' (literally "black cat fundoshi") is like the ''mokko-fundoshi'' except that the portion that passes from front to back is tailored to create a thong effect. ==== Jockstrap ==== {{Main|Jockstrap}} A jockstrap (also known as a jock, jock strap, strap, supporter, or athletic supporter) is an undergarment designed for supporting the [[human male reproductive system|male genitalia]] during sports or other vigorous physical activity. It was created by Chicago sporting goods company Sharp & Smith in 1874.{{cite book|title=Cultural Encyclopedia of the Penis|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bHytBAAAQBAJ|first1=Michael|last1=Kimmel|first2=Christine|last2=Milrod|first3=Amanda|last3=Kennedy|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield|year=2014|isbn=9780759123144|page=97}} Technically it is not a thong, as there is no narrow strap that passes up between the buttocks. A jockstrap consists of a waistband (usually [[elastomer|elastic]]) with a support pouch for the genitalia and two elastic straps affixed to the base of the pouch and to the left and right sides of the waistband at the hip.{{cite web|title=What’s the difference between a jockstrap, thong and g-string?|url=http://www.vocla.com/blog/whats-the-difference-between-a-jockstrap-thong-and-g-string/|website=VOCLA Style|access-date=15 March 2018}} The pouch, in some varieties, may be fitted with a pocket to hold an impact resistant cup to protect the [[testicle]]s and/or the [[penis]] from [[injury]]. ==== Dance belt ==== {{Main|Dance belt}} A dance belt is a type of thong designed to be used in the same manner as an athletic supporter, but for male dancers (especially in ballet).{{cite web|url=http://www.dancebelt.info/17165091C1D94631B10E/the-complete-guide-to-dance.html |title=Complete guide to dance belt |publisher=Dancebelt.info |accessdate=7 January 2012}} Its purpose is to protect and support the dancer during dance activities without being seen through outer garments, such as [[tights]], [[leotard]], gym leggings or shorts. Thongs tend to offer better support for the male anatomy than do other underwear styles (as well as eliminating contact between the genitals and inner thighs) and is one of the reasons why men and boys may choose to wear them.{{cite web|url=http://beta.byui.edu/dance/policies |title=Studio Area Dress Codes |publisher=Beta.byui.edu |accessdate=7 January 2012}} {{See also|Swim briefs}} == Controversy == {{Main|Social impact of thong underwear|Underwear as outerwear}} As thongs pass between the buttocks and, in women, may be in close contact with the anus and labia, concerns have been raised that they may become damp and act as a conduit for germ transfer, increasing the probability that the wearer may develop urinary tract infections, such as cystitis.{{cite web|url=http://goaskalice.columbia.edu/thongs-do-they-cause-utis-or-yeast-infections |title=Thongs — Do they cause UTIs or yeast infections? | Go Ask Alice! |publisher=Goaskalice.columbia.edu |date= |accessdate=2014-03-05}}{{cite web|url=http://www.redbookmag.com/health-wellness/advice/gyno-questions-yl-3|title=Your Intimate Gyno Questions Answered|author=Karen J. Bannan|work=Redbook}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thehilltoponline.com/2.4842/do-thongs-really-cause-yeast-infections-1.472432#.UfbE_sWYNok |title=Do Thongs Really Cause Yeast Infections? - Health & Fitness – The Hilltop – The Student Voice of Howard University |publisher=Thehilltoponline.com |date= |accessdate=2014-03-05}} However, research suggests that wearing thong underwear does not have a statistically significant effect on the occurrence of [[bacterial vaginosis]]{{cite journal | vauthors = Brotman RM, Ghanem KG, Klebanoff MA, Taha TE, Scharfstein DO, Zenilman JM | title = The effect of vaginal douching cessation on bacterial vaginosis: a pilot study | journal = American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology | volume = 198 | issue = 6 | pages = 628.e1–7 | year = 2008 | pmid = 18295180 | pmc = 2494605 | doi = 10.1016/j.ajog.2007.11.043 }} or [[Candidiasis|yeast infection]].[http://www.vma.mod.gov.rs/vsp/download/vsp_10_10.pdf#page=28 Risk factors for recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis] In 2002, a female high school vice principal in San Diego, California, physically checked up to 100 female students' underwear as they entered the school for a dance, with or without student permission, causing an uproar among students and some parents and eliciting an investigation by the school into the vice principal's conduct. In her defense, the vice principal said the checks were for student safety and not specifically because of the wearing of thongs.{{cite web|url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/northcounty/20020605-9999_2m5thong.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011172021/http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/northcounty/20020605-9999_2m5thong.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2007-10-11 |title=2 on RB High staff faulted for checks of undergarments |author=Eleanor Yang |publisher=SignOnSanDiego.com |date=2002-06-05 |accessdate=2014-03-05}}{{cite web|url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/northcounty/20020616-9999_2m16thong.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011175600/http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/northcounty/20020616-9999_2m16thong.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2007-10-11 |title=Demotion possible for assistant principal |author=Eleanor Yang |publisher=SignOnSanDiego.com |date=2002-06-16 |accessdate=2014-03-05}}{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2002/06/18/thong-demotion.htm |title=Assistant principal demoted after underwear check |work=USA Today |date=18 June 2002 |accessdate=7 January 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2002/06/18/national/main512654.shtml |title=CBS News |publisher=CBS News |date=11 February 2009 |accessdate=7 January 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.10news.com/news/1515763/detail.html |title=Channel 10 news |publisher=10news.com |date=17 June 2002 |accessdate=7 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111120184346/http://www.10news.com/news/1515763/detail.html |archivedate=20 November 2011 }} Of particular controversy is the retail by several outlets, including [[Abercrombie & Fitch]], [[Argos (retailer)|Argos]], and [[Etam UK|Etam]], of thongs for children as young as seven, due to their previous association with nude or erotic dancers. This controversy spawned a great deal of free publicity for Abercrombie, including a chain letter that received wide circulation.{{cite web|url=http://www.breakthechain.org/exclusives/aandf.html |title=Break the Chain website |publisher=Breakthechain.org |date=6 June 2002 |accessdate=7 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111208065730/http://www.breakthechain.org/exclusives/aandf.html |archivedate=8 December 2011 }} Media attention was drawn to the phenomenon when a British primary [[head teacher]] voiced concerns that [[student|pupils]] as young as 10 were wearing thong underwear to school.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/education/2943874.stm |title=Bbc (Uk) |publisher=BBC News |date=28 May 2003 |accessdate=7 January 2012}} Thong swimsuits are banned or strongly discouraged in some places, including most Muslim countries such as Iran.{{cite news | url=http://articles.latimes.com/2006/may/20/world/fg-dress20 | title=Iran Considering Law Against Western Attire | author=Los Angeles Times | date=9 May 2006 | accessdate=10 January 2009| work=The Los Angeles Times}}{{cite news | url=http://articles.latimes.com/2006/may/20/world/fg-dress20 | title=`Uncovered' women target of crackdown | author=Los Angeles Times | date=25 April 2007 | accessdate=10 January 2009| work=The Los Angeles Times}} Areas in the United States include such locations as [[Myrtle Beach, South Carolina]],{{cite web|url=http://www.horrycounty.org/AboutOurBeaches.aspx|title=About Our Beaches|publisher=}} and [[Kure Beach, North Carolina]].{{cite news| url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/04/28/north.carolina.no.thongs/index.html | work=CNN | title=North Carolina beach town bans thongs | date=28 April 2010}} == See also == {{portal|Fashion}} * {{Orphan|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox Organization |fullname = United States Footvolley |organizationname = USA Footvolley |abbreviation = USA-F |image = |caption = |motto = Build the base,
Promote the sport,
Achieve competitive success |formation = 2003 |extinction = |type = [[Sports governing body|National governing body (NGB)]] |status = |purpose = Organizing competitive footvolley in the USA |headquarters = [[Sunny Isles Beach, Florida|Sunny Isles Beach, FL, USA]] |region_served = United States |membership = 2,000+ |language = English |leader_title = Executive Director |leader_name = Sergio Menezes |main_organ = |parent organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = www.usafootvolley.org |remarks = }} '''USA Footvolley''' is the national [[Sport governing body|governing body]] for [[Footvolley]] in the [[United States]]. It is in charge of selecting the United States Footvolley team and any other teams which officially represent the United States, as well as the overall organization and operation of the sport within the country, in accordance with the Amateur Sports Act. The national headquarters is located in [[Sunny Isles Beach]], [[Florida]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-143726711/footvolley-hot-sport-south.html |title=Footvolley hot sport in South Beach: |accessdate=2010-01-29 |last=Woods |first=Casey |date=March 27, 2006 |work=[[Miami Herald]] |publisher=Miami Herald }}{{cite news |title=Footvolley’s popularity taking off in South Florida|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/living/health-fitness/article51001670.html|publisher=[[Miami Herald]]}} ==History== Footvolley was created by Octavio de Moraes in 1965{{Cite web|url=http://www.footvolley.net/news.php?nsid=17 |title=Birthplace of Footvolley to Host Olympic Games! |accessdate=2010-01-29 |work=Pro Footvolley Tour, LLC }} in [[Rio de Janeiro]]'s [[Copacabana (Rio de Janeiro)|Copacabana Beach]]. The game of footvolley - first called 'pevoley', literally meaning "footvolley", that was discarded for "futevôlei". Footvolley started in Rio de Janeiro; however cities like [[Recife]], [[Salvador, Bahia|Salvador]], [[Brasília]], [[Goiânia]], [[Santos, São Paulo|Santos]] and [[Florianópolis]] have players who have been playing footvolley since the 1970s. Teams of footvolley had five a side at first. Due to the skill level of the footvolley athletes (nearly all were professional football players), the ball would rarely drop. The players began lowering the number of players on each side, eventually settling on 2 versus 2, which is still in use today.{{Cite web|url=http://www.futevolei.com.br/Historia.html |title=Futevolei Historia |accessdate=2010-01-29 |work=Futevolei.com.br }} ''[https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=pt&u=http://www.futevolei.com.br/Historia.html&ei=9zljS9ukC4eXtgepss24Bg&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBAQ7gEwAA&prev=/search%3Fq%3Dhttp://www.futevolei.com.br/Historia.html%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26sa%3DG%26num%3D50 English translation]'' The first International Footvolley event to occur outside of Brazil was in 2003 by the United States Footvolley Association on Miami Beach at the 2003 Fitness Festival. Brazilian athletes: Wellington Correa 'Helinho' and Renan were the Champions of the competition; but the sport gained steam for international development. In 2016, the City of Sunny Isles Beach, FL provided USA Footvolley its Official Training Centre. Here is where the National Team trains. ==Organizational structure== There are several parts and levels that make up USA Footvolley. There is the National governing body (national) level, the Zone (regional) level, and the Local Footvolley Committee (local/state) level. ===Pro Footvolley Tour rules=== The rules in the [[United States]] professional tour [[Pro Footvolley Tour]] are designed to make the matches faster and more aggressive. Some of the notable differences are: net height of 2.10 Meters; 2-pointers are awarded up to 3-times maximum per set for all shots scored with the foot when one foot goes above the head when striking the ball and the other foot is off the ground (bikes, matrix kicks, etc.){{cite news |title=Pro Footvolley Tour |url=http://wlrn.org/post/shark-attack-beach-footvolleys-popularity-taking-florida-us// |publisher=[[wlrn]]}} Pro Footvolley Tour airs on Root Sports, Comcast SportsNet, Time Warner SportsChannel, Bright House Networks, WapaDeportes, and CaribVision. Through DirecTV Pro Footvolley Tour can be seen in the entire United States and Puerto Rico.{{cite news |title=Explore DirectTV |url=https://www.directv.com/tv/Pro-Footvolley-Tour-c01jckE2UEpKYms9/Episode-UW5ZWjRPRVVvQkhRZzFtanlJaWJPZz09 |publisher=[[DirectTV]]}}{{cite news |title=Comcast |url=http://corporate.comcast.com/images/sportsnet-houston1.pdf |publisher=[[Comcast NBC Universal]]}} ===National Championship/US Open=== The National Championship is exactly what the name implies. There is only 1 National Championship meet at the conclusion of each season across the country. The National Championships are also of the invitational meet format and offer extremely high level competition. Only a very small percentage of people who ever play footvolley will make it to this high a level of competition. This meet is generally used to determine the US National Team for various international level meets each year, but is not used to determine the US Olympic Team. ===US Olympic Trials=== The United States Olympic Trials will be held for the first time on June 25 in [[Seaside, Oregon]]. This event will be held once every 4 years. Since this meet offers such a coveted prize (a spot on the US Olympic Team) for the 2016 Rio Olympics exhibition tournament. United States citizenship is required to compete at this meet since only United States citizens are allowed to represent the United States at the Olympics. The Olympic Trials are also under unique requirements made by the [[United States Footvolley Association|USFA]]. Trials meets are also held for the World Championships and World University Games, typically at a national championship meet. ==See also== {{Portal|Footvolley}} *[[United States Sports]] *[[Pro Footvolley Tour]] *[[Ginga Scout]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.usafootvolley.org/ USA Footvolley] {{Sports governing bodies of the United States}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Usa Footvolley}} [[Category:Sports governing bodies in the United States|Swimming]] [[Category:Sports rules and regulations]] [[Category:Organizations based in Miami]] [[Category:Sports in Miami]] [[Category:Sports organisations established in 2003]] [[Category:2003 establishments in Florida]]
